intro: Cenchropsis myosuroides, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with small, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water. Its flowers are typically white or pale blue, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Cenchropsis myosuroides is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, making it a hardy species often found in sandy or rocky soils.
